name: Amber American Lager
desc: Amber lager features prevalent malt flavors with varying levels of hoppiness. This beer is also characterized by a darker color, caramel aroma, and smooth taste.

name: IPA - India Pale Ale
desc: American IPAs have more hops, big herbal or citrus flavors, and high bitterness compared to pale ale.

name: Belgian Pale Ale
desc: Belgian pale ale contains a toasted malt flavor that is subtle enough to not overpower the taste of the hops.

name: Stout
desc: American stouts feature malt flavors working to create strong chocolate and coffee notes, but without overpowering hop bitterness.

name: Amber Lager
desc: Amber lager features prevalent malt flavors with varying levels of hoppiness. This beer is also characterized by a darker color, caramel aroma, and smooth taste.

name: Brown Ale
desc: American brown ale is a dark beer without the bitterness of porters and stouts. This style boasts a dark caramel color and a medium to full-bodied profile.
